Gripper kinematics

Contents

  • kinematics.parallel_jaw
  • kinematics.barrett_hand

Gripper kinematics#

Many operations in the optim module require the recalculation of the gripper kinematics with new configurations, and need to differentiate with respect to the configuration. The kinematic submodule replicates the kinematics from the used grippers with homogeneous transformation matrices and makes them differentiable with JAX.

Note

Although all hands have been implemented, only the parallel jaw gripper has been tested for correctness.

Warning

Gripper kinematics are hardcoded and do not adapt to changes in the robot configuration in the environment asset files!

kinematics.parallel_jaw#

Parallel Jaw gripper kinematics module.

optim.grippers.kinematics.parallel_jaw.kin_pj_full(x: Union[numpy.ndarray, jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray]) → Union[Tuple[numpy.ndarray], Tuple[jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray]]#

Compute all link frames of the ParallelJaw gripper.

Parameters

x – Joint configuration.

Returns

The joint frames of all links.

optim.grippers.kinematics.parallel_jaw.kin_pj_right(x: Union[numpy.ndarray, jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray]) → Union[numpy.ndarray, jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray]#

Compute the frame of the ParallelJaw gripper’s right finger.

Frame position is located at the center of the inner surface of the finger.

Parameters

x – Joint configuration.

Returns

The finger frame.

optim.grippers.kinematics.parallel_jaw.kin_pj_left(x: Union[numpy.ndarray, jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray]) → Union[numpy.ndarray, jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray]#

Compute the frame of the ParallelJaw gripper’s left finger.

Frame position is located at the center of the inner surface of the finger.

Parameters

x – Joint configuration.

Returns

The finger frame.

kinematics.barrett_hand#

BarrettHand kinematics module.

optim.grippers.kinematics.barrett_hand.kin_1dist_p(x: Union[numpy.ndarray, jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray]) → Union[numpy.ndarray, jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray]#

Compute the frame of the BarrettHand’s first finger tip.

Parameters

x – Joint configuration.

Returns

The finger tip frame.

optim.grippers.kinematics.barrett_hand.kin_2dist_p(x: Union[numpy.ndarray, jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray]) → Union[numpy.ndarray, jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray]#

Compute the frame of the BarrettHand’s second finger tip.

Parameters

x – Joint configuration.

Returns

The finger tip frame.

optim.grippers.kinematics.barrett_hand.kin_3dist_p(x: Union[numpy.ndarray, jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray]) → Union[numpy.ndarray, jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray]#

Compute the frame of the BarrettHand’s third finger tip.

Parameters

x – Joint configuration.

Returns

The finger tip frame.

optim.grippers.kinematics.barrett_hand.kin_bh_full(x: Union[numpy.ndarray, jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray]) → Union[Tuple[numpy.ndarray], Tuple[jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray]]#

Compute all link frames of the BarrettHand.

Parameters

x – Joint configuration.

Returns

The joint frames of all links.

kinematics.shadow_hand#

ShadowHand kinematics module.

optim.grippers.kinematics.shadow_hand.kin_sh_full(x: Union[numpy.ndarray, jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray]) → Union[Tuple[numpy.ndarray], Tuple[jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray]]#

Compute all link frames of the ShadowHand.

See https://www.shadowrobot.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/shadow_dexterous_hand_e_technical_specification.pdf # noqa: E501 for frame names and numbers. Finger tips are denoted with 0.

Parameters

x – Joint configuration.

Returns

The joint frames of all links.

kinematics.tf#

Transformations module for creating homogeneous transformation matrices compatible with JAX.

optim.grippers.kinematics.tf.tf_matrix(v: jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray) → jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray#

Construct a homogeneous transformation matrix from a position and euler angles.

Parameters

v – Array containing the position and euler angles.

Returns

The transformation matrix.

optim.grippers.kinematics.tf.tf_matrix_q(v: jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray) → jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray#

Construct a homogeneous transformation matrix from a position and a quaterion.

Parameters

v – Array containing the position and quaternion.

Returns

The transformation matrix.

optim.grippers.kinematics.tf.zrot_matrix(theta: jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray) → jax._src.numpy.ndarray.ndarray#

Create a homogeneous z-rotation transformation matrix.

Parameters

theta – Angle of the desired z-rotation.
